Event.name: Recording
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> sets down in permanent form information about the occurrence of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. Alternatively, the <fen>Agent</fen> records that an <fen>Entity</fen> had a particular <fen>Value</fen> for one of its <fen>Attribute</fen>s.
<ex><fex name="Time">While visiting in Port Alberni, the day before he was diagnosed,</fex> <fex name="Agent">we</fex> <t>recorded</t> <fex name="Phenomenon">him</fex> <fex name="Phenomenon">to have 14 drinks and go to the bathroom 10 times</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Phenomenon">William Hickey's death</fex> is not <t>recorded</t>. <fex name="Agent">CNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Attribute">The voter turnout</fex> was <t>recorded</t> <fex name="Value">as over 90 percent</fex>. <fex name="age">CNI</fex></ex> <ex>...... <fex name="Entity">voter</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Phen">A number of US expressions of alarm presented during those weeks to the Israeli government</fex> were <t>registered</t> <fex name="med">in the premier's diary</fex>. <fex name="age">CNI</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the sentient entity that creates a permanent record of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<ex>Police informed Mr Wong that <fex name="age">they</fex> <t>recorded</t> the attack as a racial incident.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Phenomenon
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the entity or situation in the world of which a <fen>Agent</fen> becomes aware.
<ex>Adams took some very good advice and meticulously <t>recorded</t> <fex name="Phen">the events that ensued</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>eagerly</ment>, <ment>carefully</ment>).</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifes the action whereby the <fen>Agent</fen> creates a record of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> creates the record of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The goal that the <fen>Agent</fen> has in mind in creating a record of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> uses an <fen>Instrument</fen> in order to create a record of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> or to measure an <fen>Entity</fen>'s <fen>Value</fen> for a specified <fen>Attribute</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Attribute
Arg.definition:
<def-root>That feature of the <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
<ex>When Mohammed was sentenced to death in the Anti-Terrorism Court in Rawalpindi the court <t>recorded</t> <fex name="Attribute">his age</fex> as 17 or 18.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Value
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Value</fen> of the <fen>Entity</fen> that is recorded for the specified <fen>Attribute</fen>.
<ex>In the fiscal year 2000, Nepal's imports from China and Tibet were <t>recorded</t> <fex name="Value">at 166.6 million dollars</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Entity
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> for which the <fen>Agent</fen> records the <fen>Value</fen> of an <fen>Attribute</fen>.
<ex>At the time the Army <t>recorded</t> <fex name="ent">him</fex> as a married resident of the Town of Two Creeks.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity in which the <fen>Agent</fen> creates a record of their impression of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<ex>In fact, Pepys <t>recorded</t> everything <fex name="med">in his diary</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Language
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The symbolic system used by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex> I <t>recorded</t> my notes <fex name="med">in English</fex>, usually translating from French.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> sets down the facts.
<ex>From what the book says, these events were <t>recorded</t> <fex name="pla">in the Chamber of Mazarbul</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> has been documented.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount of times the <fen>Agent</fen> records something per unit of time.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Duration</fen> denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.</def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes a duration in which the recording event occurred iteratively.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: document.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: record in written, photographic, or other form.

lexUnit.name: chronicle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: record (a series of events) in a factual and detailed way.
